alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Northern Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 3:30AM CST until January 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle and areas of dense freezing fog. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 2 to 7 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Aitkin and Carlton and South St. Louis Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Mille Lacs Band, Big Sandy Lake area and the Fond du Lac Band. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing drizzle is expected to continue through this morning, producing a light glaze of ice that may result in poor driving conditions. In addition, areas of dense freezing fog may reduce visibilities as low as one quarter mile at times. If you are traveling this morning, be sure to reduce speed, leave plenty of distance between vehicles, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Northern Aitkin
